daily_summary.headline: Aurora and Routine Launches Dominate the Day

top_events.title: G1 Geomagnetic Storm
top_events.description: A G1 geomagnetic storm is expected on February 5th, offering potential aurora visibility down to 60° latitude.
top_events.action: Check skies if you're at high latitudes.

top_events.title: Routine Starlink Launches
top_events.description: Multiple Falcon 9 launches for Starlink satellite deployments are scheduled, maintaining the expansion of the constellation.
top_events.action: Watch live streams for the latest launches.

top_events.title: Chinese Reusable Space Vehicle Launch
top_events.description: Launch of a Chinese reusable space vehicle, details are top secret but significant for China's space capabilities.
top_events.action: Follow updates for any new information.

alerts.title: G1 Geomagnetic Storm Alert
alerts.message: A G1 geomagnetic storm is expected on February 5th, offering potential aurora visibility down to 60° latitude.
alerts.action_required: Check skies if you're at high latitudes and conditions are clear.

opportunities.recommendation: Good viewing opportunity for high-latitude observers. Worth checking if you're above 60° latitude and skies are clear.
Possible aurora at high latitudes. Best for northern locations (65°+). Worth checking if conditions are optimal.
